Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

Chris Burdess said

>> If you want to model relationships between resources 
>> then you need to use an appropriate modelling metaphor 
>> such as RDF (perhaps in this simple case you could use 
>> WebDAV bindings instead). Thus, you would have
>> resources:

Aw. I so totally didn't follow that. Why do you need RDF.  Why can't he PUT
to  <http://foo/person/bob> http://foo/person/bob or
<http://foo/location/virginia> http://foo/location/virginia (whichever would
be more approriate?)
 

-Mike Schinkel 
http://www.mikeschinkel.com/blogs/ 
http://www.welldesignedurls.org/
